intro: Ourouparia hirsuta, commonly known as the hairy ourouparia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which give it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. The species is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
